Description: Rogues are masters of stealth and deception.
Weapons: You are Trained in 2 Weapon Categories of choice (e.g. 1-Handed Melee, 2-Handed Ranged, Shields, etc).
Language:
You know Thieves' Cant!
Thieves' Cant is not a spoken language, but rather a set of symbols, sign language and code names for various objects, places or people.
Use Thieves' Cant wisely!
Proficiency Requirements: You have Proficiency in Stealth and a number of extra Proficiencies equal to your Intelligence.

~Proficiency in Stealth~.Effect: Add your Level to all Dexterity Checks for hiding, remaining quiet, moving silently, blending in a crowd, etc.

Proficiencies Description:
Rogues are naturally talented when it comes to subtlety. Proficiency in stealth may come in handy particularily if the Game Master ever issues you to roll a Check for remaining stealthed when you use Hide (an Ability you get as a Rogue, see below).

Rogues can be experienced in many domains, from city dwelling to dungeoneering, so choose well!

Spellcasting.Spell Grade: 6 + Intelligence or Charisma, whichever is higher

Mana.Regain: You regain all Mana back inbetween Adventures.

Spellcasting.Change: You can change your known Spells and Talents inbetween Adventures.
Spellcasting.Other: All Rogue-specific Abilities are not considered Spells (unless stated otherwise).
Spellcasting.Recommended Abilities Description: Shank is there to help you spend your Mana in uncanny situations where you need just a little more damage to finish of an enemy. In case of an emergency, Recuperate is there to heal you, while Slam will deal area damage in case you're fighting multiple enemies. Finally, if you find out your enemies are resistant to your weapon attacks, get Lightstrike. It's situational, but it can be effective!

Starting Abilities Description.Ambush:
Ambush can normally happen only once per turn, and you can charge it up to deal more Damage!
However, your Rogue Specialization will give you extra ways to Ambush target!

Starting Abilities Description.Hide:
Essentially, you can interrupt another Unit's turn, put that unit on pause, and start your turn. When your turn ends, the Unit resumes its turn.
Before you attack an enemy group, you can tell your DM where you are sitting, so that you benefit from cover.

~Ambush~.Effect: If you start your turn Hidden, your first weapon attack deals 1d8 extra Damage.
~Ambush~.Notes: Your Specialization will give you extra ways to Ambush.

~Hide~.Effect:
When combat starts, if you have Cover from all enemies, you start as Hidden.
While Hidden, you can skip your turn.
Then, you can unhide and start your turn whenever you like (even during enemies' turns)!
~Hide~.Notes:
Starting your turn unhides you.
Be careful: if you don't start your turn this round, you lose your turn!
If you want to start during an enemy's turn, you do so when they declare they want to do something or after they finish doing something.
In special circumstances, the DM might ask you to make a Dexterity Check to be or remain Hidden.
You can't become Hidden through non-Ability means.

Specializations.Description:
At Level 1, you can choose your specialization.
Every Rogue can choose from the following Rogue specializations
Choices: Thief, an agile-handed individual, crafty and stealthy, dexterous and silent
Assassin, a person specialized in taking targets out one-on-one, through whatever means
Skirmisher, an outlaw who is not afraid to engage in direct combat and apply whatever tricks necessary to get the job done

~Backstab~.Effect: When you Flank an enemy, Ambush is applied.
~Backstab~.Upgrade:
When Ambushing, you can also spend as much Mana as you want.
That attack gains 1d8 extra Damage for each Mana spent (on top of the 1d8).
~Backstab~.Notes: Ambush from Hidden and Backstab don't stack (only one d8 is added).

~Agile Hand~.Effect: You are immune to Fumbling. You can freely Break your movement.

~Fool's Coin~.Effect:
After you spend Mana on Ambush, choose one of the rolled dice of the attack (including the base weapon dice and base ambush dice). Gain that many Gold Tokens.
Gold Tokens are an imaginary currency.
When in a town or city, you convert all Gold Tokens to actual gold coins (1 Gold Token for 10 Gold). You need to spend 1 hour to do this.
~Fool's Coin~.Notes: Lore-wise, as a Thief you steal successfully in a city when converting tokens, while preparing and gaining momentum for it in combat.

<Payback Shot>.Effect:
A Unit within 2 meters must pass a Dexterity Check or be Stunned.
For every 2 Gold Tokens you spent, increase the Grade of this by 1.

<Arcane Trickster>.Effect:
You can now cast spells!
Your Intelligence increases by 1 (up to a maximum of 4).
You gain access to the Arcane and Conjuration Basic Ability Lists, but at most half of all your Known Basic Abilities can be Arcane or Conjuration Spells.
Fool's Coin now also applies when spending Mana on a Spell.
<Arcane Trickster>.Notes: You lose access to these Spells if you change this Talent.

<Way of Fooling>.Effect: Your Charisma increases by 2 (up to a maximum of 4).

<Whiplash>.Effect:
Throw a whiplash at a grabbable point within 6 meters.
Pull yourself to a target point.
After using Whiplash, your next weapon attack this turn applies Ambush if you haven't already Ambushed this turn.
<Whiplash>.Notes: Requires a Whiplash item, which can be bought for 100 gold.

<Thief Shock Wire>.Range: 6 meters to end in line of sight
<Thief Shock Wire>.Effect:
Deploy a Shock Tripwire of up to 5 meters long between 2 obstacles.
When a Unit passes through the tripwire, it takes 1d10 Shock Damage and must pass a Dexterity Check with -3 or be Rooted.
<Thief Shock Wire>.Upgrade: A Unit can only see the tripwire only if it has 3 or more Sense.
<Thief Shock Wire>.Notes:
Each end of the wire must be attached to something solid and static.
You can make use of walls, obstacles, etc.
Requires a Special Tripwire Set which can be bought for 100 gold.

<Blade Tempest>.Effect:
You throw out 8 boomerang star blades: one towards each direction (up, up-right, right, etc).
Each blade travels 4 meters and stops in that space (can occupy the same space as another Unit).
Each blade deals 2d6 Slash Damage to all Units it passes through.
At the end of your next turn, the blades return to you.
Then, again, each blade deals 2d6 Slash Damage to all Units it passes through.
<Blade Tempest>.Notes: Requires 8 special blades, which can be bought for a total of 120 gold. If you're playing on a Grid, take semi-hitting into account for blades that don't travel squares exactly in the 8 directions. Cover applies normally to each blade.

<Poisoned Weapons>.Effect:
You coat up to 2 weapons in different poisons that last for 8 hours.
Choose 2 weapons, and choose a different poison to apply for each:
{Diamond} Deathly Venom: Deals 1d8 extra Poison Damage to targets with more than 50% Health; then the target becomes immune to this poison for 1 minute.
{Diamond} Necrotic Toxin: The attack's target becomes Slowed and can't regain Health for 1 minute
{Diamond} Phosphorus Mix: The target can't benefit from Cover for 1 minute (and this attack ignores Cover)
{Diamond} Weakening Poison: The target can only do 1 Attack on their next turn
<Poisoned Weapons>.Notes:
Remember to specify which weapon you are attacking to.
Requires a Poisoner's Kit which can be bought for 200 gold on the black market. If you're in a tight scenario, the DM might let you use monster blood or gather herbs for a 1-time use of this Ability.

<Savage Ambush>.Effect:
When you declare an attack on a Unit that has 50% or less Health (before your attack's Damage), the attack gain Ambush.
Ambush can apply twice at the same time, from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<Savage Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if you Ambush the target and it also has 50% or less Health, the total Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and you would also Ambush from your Specialization Ambush Ability condition, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
The maximum Damage is 2d8, even if you match 3 conditions for Ambush (e.g. Hiding, Savage Ambush and your Specialization's Ambush Ability).
You can still add Ambush Damage only once per turn (e.g. not with 2 separate attacks; it must be one single attack).

<First-Shot Ambush>.Effect:
When you declare an attack on a Unit that has full Health, the attack gain Ambush.
Ambush can apply twice at the same time, from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<First-Shot Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if you Ambush the target and it also has full Health, then the total Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and you would also Ambush from your Specialization Ambush Ability condition, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
The maximum Damage is 2d8, even if you match 3 conditions for Ambush (e.g. Hiding, First-Shot Ambush and your Specialization's Ambush Ability).
You can still add Ambush Damage only once per turn (e.g. not with 2 separate attacks; it must be one single attack).

<Instinctive Ambush>.Effect:
After you use a 0 Actions Ability, your next weapon attack this turn gains Ambush.
Ambush can happen twice per turn (even at the same time) from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<Instinctive Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if you just used a 0 Actions Ability but you would Ambush anyway, the Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and you would also Ambush from your Specialization Ambush Ability condition, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
Or, if you were hiding and Ambush, then use a 0 Actions Ability, then attack again, that second attack also gains Ambush (1d8 extra Damage).

~Isolated~.Effect: When you attack a Unit, and there is no other Unit within 1 meter of either of you, the attack gains Ambush.
~Isolated~.Upgrade:
When Ambushing, you can also spend as much Mana as you want.
That attack gains 1d8 extra Damage for each Mana spent (on top of the 1d8).
~Isolated~.Notes: Ambush from Hidden and Isolated don't stack (only one d8 is added).

~Planned Assassination~.Effect:
You plan an attack for 1 minute.
Your next weapon attack on that target deals an extra 1d12 Damage.
Planned Assassination fails if your Line of Sight to the target is broken until you attack it.
~Planned Assassination~.Notes: The Mana is spent the moment you declare Planned Assassination. You can use plan assassinations on multiple targets, but you can't plan an assassination on a single target multiple times at the same time.

<Take Out>.Effect:
A non-Epic Unit within 1 meter must pass a Dexterity Check or be put to Sleep for 1 minute.
If it fails, you gain the Action back.
<Take Out>.Downside:
You must be hiding to use Take Out, and the target must be Isolated.
This ability unhides you!

<Poison Master>.Effect:
Using ingredients costing 35 Gold, you are able to create a few drops of Drinkable Poison.
Someone ingesting them takes 1d12 Poison Damage instantly.
Combining multiple instances of Drinkable Poison increases its Damage by 1d12 for each Drinkable Poison combined.
The poison loses its effect after 72 hours.

<Shadowstep>.Effect:
If you are covered in shadow, choose another point covered in shadow up to 6 meters away.
Instantly teleport to that place.

<Blade Tempest>.Effect:
You throw out 8 boomerang star blades: one towards each direction (up, up-right, right, etc).
Each blade travels 4 meters and stops in that space (can occupy the same space as another Unit).
Each blade deals 2d6 Slash Damage to all Units it passes through.
At the end of your next turn, the blades return to you.
Then, again, each blade deals 2d6 Slash Damage to all Units it passes through.
<Blade Tempest>.Notes: Requires 8 special blades, which can be bought for a total of 120 gold. If you're playing on a Grid, take semi-hitting into account for blades that don't travel squares exactly in the 8 directions. Cover applies normally to each blade.

<Death Mark>.Effect:
Mark a Unit you can see.
Whenever YOU deal Damage to it until your next turn, remember the Damage done.
At the start of your next turn, the mark bursts and the Unit takes directly 33% of the Damage you dealt to it in this time period.

<Poisoned Weapons>.Effect:
You coat up to 2 weapons in different poisons that last for 8 hours.
Choose 2 weapons, and choose a different poison to apply for each:
{Diamond} Deathly Venom: Deals 1d8 extra Poison Damage to targets with more than 50% Health; then the target becomes immune to this poison for 1 minute.
{Diamond} Necrotic Toxin: The attack's target becomes Slowed and can't regain Health for 1 minute
{Diamond} Phosphorus Mix: The target can't benefit from Cover for 1 minute (and this attack ignores Cover)
{Diamond} Weakening Poison: The target can only do 1 Attack on their next turn
<Poisoned Weapons>.Notes:
Remember to specify which weapon you are attacking to.
Requires a Poisoner's Kit which can be bought for 200 gold on the black market. If you're in a tight scenario, the DM might let you use monster blood or gather herbs for a 1-time use of this Ability.

<Savage Ambush>.Effect:
When you declare an attack on a Unit that has 50% or less Health (before your attack's Damage), the attack gain Ambush.
Ambush can apply twice at the same time, from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<Savage Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if you Ambush the target and it also has 50% or less Health, the total Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and you would also Ambush from your Specialization Ambush Ability condition, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
The maximum Damage is 2d8, even if you match 3 conditions for Ambush (e.g. Hiding, Savage Ambush and your Specialization's Ambush Ability).
You can still add Ambush Damage only once per turn (e.g. not with 2 separate attacks; it must be one single attack).

<First-Shot Ambush>.Effect:
When you declare an attack on a Unit that has full Health, the attack gain Ambush.
Ambush can apply twice at the same time, from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<First-Shot Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if you Ambush the target and it also has full Health, then the total Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and you would also Ambush from your Specialization Ambush Ability condition, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
The maximum Damage is 2d8, even if you match 3 conditions for Ambush (e.g. Hiding, First-Shot Ambush and your Specialization's Ambush Ability).
You can still add Ambush Damage only once per turn (e.g. not with 2 separate attacks; it must be one single attack).

<Instinctive Ambush>.Effect:
After you use a 0 Actions Ability, your next weapon attack this turn gains Ambush.
Ambush can happen twice per turn (even at the same time) from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<Instinctive Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if you just used a 0 Actions Ability but you would Ambush anyway, the Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and you would also Ambush from your Specialization Ambush Ability condition, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
Or, if you were hiding and Ambush, then use a 0 Actions Ability, then attack again, that second attack also gains Ambush (1d8 extra Damage).

<Finale>.Effect: For each attack, Ability and application of Ambush you made this turn, deal 1d10 Damage that ignores Defense.

~Savagery~.Effect: When you declare an attack on a Unit that has 50% or less Health (before your attack's Damage), the attack gain Ambush.
~Savagery~.Upgrade:
When Ambushing, you can also spend as much Mana as you want.
That attack gains 1d8 extra Damage for each Mana spent (on top of the 1d8).
~Savagery~.Notes: Ambush from Hidden and Savagery don't stack (only one d8 is added).

~Parry~.Effect: Halve the Damage of a weapon attack you receive (after the roll, before subtracting Defense).

<10% Luck>.Effect: Once per turn, when you roll a 1 for a Damage die, you can reroll that die.

<Cheap Tricks>.Effect: A Unit within 3 meters must pass a Dexterity Check or take 1d4 Poison Damage and be Blinded.

<Whiplash>.Effect:
Throw a whiplash at a grabbable point within 6 meters.
Pull yourself to a target point.
After using Whiplash, your next weapon attack this turn applies Ambush if you haven't already Ambushed this turn.
<Whiplash>.Notes: Requires a Whiplash item, which can be bought for 100 gold.

<Quickfire>.Effect:
Perform an attack with a 1-Handed weapon (for 0 Actions).
This attack ignores Cover and has no pentaly if you're Blinded or Fumbling.
This attack can be used in melee range without penalty if it's a ranged weapon.

<Combat Shock Wire>.Range: 6 meters to end in line of sight
<Combat Shock Wire>.Effect:
Whenever you spend one or more Mana, freely deploy a Shock Tripwire of up to 5 meters long between 2 obstacles.
When a Unit passes through the tripwire, it takes 1d10 Shock Damage and must pass a Dexterity Check with -3 or be Rooted.
A Unit can see the tripwire only if it has 3 or more Sense.
<Combat Shock Wire>.Notes:
Each end of the wire must be attached to something solid and static.
You can make use of walls, obstacles, etc.
Requires a Special Tripwire Set which can be bought for 200 gold.

<Poisoned Weapons>.Effect:
You coat up to 2 weapons in different poisons that last for 8 hours.
Choose 2 weapons, and choose a different poison to apply for each:
{Diamond} Deathly Venom: Deals 1d8 extra Poison Damage to targets with more than 50% Health; then the target becomes immune to this poison for 1 minute.
{Diamond} Necrotic Toxin: The attack's target becomes Slowed and can't regain Health for 1 minute
{Diamond} Phosphorus Mix: The target can't benefit from Cover for 1 minute (and this attack ignores Cover)
{Diamond} Weakening Poison: The target can only do 1 Attack on their next turn
<Poisoned Weapons>.Notes:
Remember to specify which weapon you are attacking to.
Requires a Poisoner's Kit which can be bought for 200 gold on the black market. If you're in a tight scenario, the DM might let you use monster blood or gather herbs for a 1-time use of this Ability.

<Swing Thing>.Effect:
Use when a Unit within 6 meters becomes affected by Crowd Control of any type except Slow (including being Pushed) (you must have line of sight to it).
Deal 1d10 Pierce Damage to it and push it up to 3 meters in any direction.
<Swing Thing>.Notes:
Requires a Whiplash item for pushing towards you or to a side, which can be bought for 100 gold.
For pushing away from you, requires a gun or crossbow of any type.

<Backstab Ambush>.Effect:
When you Flank an enemy, the attack gains Ambush.
Ambush can apply twice at the same time, from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<Backstab Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if the target has 50% or less Health and you're also Flanking it, the total Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and the target would also have 50% or less Health, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
The maximum Damage is 2d8, even if you match 3 conditions for Ambush (e.g. Hiding, 50% Health and Flanking).
You can still add Ambush Damage only once per turn (e.g. not with 2 separate attacks; it must be one single attack).

<Isolated Ambush>.Effect:
When you attack a Unit, and there is no other Unit within 1 meter of either of you, the attack gains Ambush.
Ambush can apply twice at the same time, from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<Isolated Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if the target has 50% or less Health and it's also Isolated, the total Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and the target would also have 50% or less Health, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
The maximum Damage is 2d8, even if you match 3 conditions for Ambush (e.g. Hiding, 50% Health and Flanking).
You can still add Ambush Damage only once per turn (e.g. not with 2 separate attacks; it must be one single attack).

<Instinctive Ambush>.Effect:
After you use a 0 Actions Ability, your next weapon attack this turn gains Ambush.
Ambush can happen twice per turn (even at the same time) from 2 different Ambush conditions.
<Instinctive Ambush>.Notes:
E.g. if you just used a 0 Actions Ability but you would Ambush anyway, the Ambush Damage is 2d8 Damage. Or, for another example, if you were Hiding and you would also Ambush from your Specialization Ambush Ability condition, the attack gains 2d8 Damage.
Or, if you were hiding and Ambush, then use a 0 Actions Ability, then attack again, that second attack also gains Ambush (1d8 extra Damage).

<Momentum Dance>.Effect: Gain Shielding equal to your current Initiative in combat.
